definition: lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
seam/crack/narrow slit/CL:道[dao4]
to sew/to stitch
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
old variant of 插[cha1]
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
variant of 針|针[zhen1], needle

sentences.english: They issue the standard almost all business ground of make use of every bit of time or space moved China.
sentences.chinese: 他们几乎把旗下所有业务都见缝插针地搬到了中国。

sentences.english: Motorcycles can make use of every bit of space, not bothered by traffic.
sentences.chinese: 摩托车可以见缝插针，不受堵车之累。

sentences.english: Somewhere on the trip we even fit in a round of miniature golf.
sentences.chinese: 我们甚至见缝插针，在旅途中打了一局迷你高尔夫。

definition: gap (between two objects)/interval of time (between events)/opening in one's schedule/free time/(fig.) gap (in the market etc)
idle/free time/leisure/unused (place)
gap/interval
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
neutral gear
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1

definition: to take some time out/to make use of a spare moment
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
to stagger (times)
lit. to drill a hole/to take advantage of a loophole/to exploit an advantage/to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)
(idiom) take care of everything; handle everything
without end/incessantly/on and on
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
leisure
leisure/free time/unoccupied/not in use
